samples.context: Sam wanted to become a better programmer, so he started contributing to open source projects. He fixed bugs, added features, and reviewed other people's code. Sam realized that if he gains experience, then he will improve his coding abilities.
samples.question: Based on context, can we say, at least one of the following must always be true? (a) Sam does not gain experience and (b) He will improve his coding abilities.

samples.context: Maria wanted to become fluent in French, so she downloaded language learning software and began practicing every day. She listened to audio lessons, did speaking exercises and had conversations with native speakers. Maria understood that if she immerses herself in the language, then she will master French.
samples.question: Based on context, can we say, at least one of the following must always be true? (a) Maria does not immerse herself in the language and (b) Maria will master French.

samples.context: The company wanted to increase sales, so it expanded its marketing budget and launched a new advertising campaign. It took out ads in print, online, radio and TV to reach a broader audience. The marketing team knew that if they boost brand awareness, then they will see an increase in product sales.
samples.question: Based on context, can we say, at least one of the following must always be true? (a) The company does not boost brand awareness and (b) The company will see an increase in product sales.

samples.context: Maria wanted to save for retirement, so she started contributing to her 401k plan. She had money automatically deducted from each paycheck. Maria knew that if she regularly sets aside a portion of her income, then she will be financially secure in her later years.
samples.question: Based on context, can we say, at least one of the following must always be true? (a) Maria does not regularly set aside a portion of her income and (b) Maria will be financially secure in her later years.

samples.context: The company wanted to improve customer satisfaction, so they invested in employee training. They provided workshops on communication, empathy, and problem-solving. The company knew that if they equip staff with key skills, then customers will have positive service experiences.
samples.question: Based on context, can we say, at least one of the following must always be true? (a) The company does not equip staff with key skills and (b) Customers will have positive service experiences.

samples.context: John was struggling in his math class, so he decided to put in extra effort. He attended tutoring sessions, did all the homework, and studied for hours before each test. John knew that if he works hard, then he will improve his math grade.
samples.question: Based on the context, can we say at least one of the following must be true? (a) John does not work hard (b) John will improve his math grade

samples.context: The city wanted to reduce traffic congestion, so they expanded public transportation options. They increased bus frequency and built new subway lines. The city planners understood that if they improve transit infrastructure, then more people will use public transport instead of driving.
samples.question: Based on context, can we say, at least one of the following must always be true? (a) The city does not improve transit infrastructure and (b) More people will use public transport instead of driving.

samples.context: Jane wanted to improve her photography skills, so she started taking an online course. She learned techniques for composition, lighting, and editing. Jane realized that if she develops her skills, then her photos will look more professional.
samples.question: Based on context, can we say, at least one of the following must always be true? (a) Jane does not develop her skills and (b) Her photos will look more professional.

samples.context: Jenny wanted to keep her house clean, so she made a schedule for chores and cleaning. She assigned specific tasks like vacuuming, laundry, and bathroom cleaning to certain days of the week. Jenny understood that if she maintains a cleaning routine, then the house will stay tidy.
samples.question: Based on the context, can we say at least one of the following must be true? (a) Jenny does not maintain a cleaning routine (b) The house will stay tidy

samples.context: Jim was stressed from work, so he made meditation part of his daily routine. He downloaded a meditation app and practiced breathing exercises and mindfulness techniques. Jim knew that if he meditates regularly, then his stress levels will decrease.
samples.question: Based on the context, can we say at least one of the following must be true? (a) Jim does not meditate regularly (b) Jim's stress levels will decrease
